skill.name: parallel-swarm-implementation
skill.description: Loop 2 of the Three-Loop Integrated Development System. META-SKILL that dynamically compiles Loop 1 plans into agent+skill execution graphs. Queen Coordinator selects optimal agents from 86-agent registry and assigns skills (when available) or custom instructions. 9-step swarm with theater detection and reality validation. Receives plans from research-driven-planning, feeds to cicd-intelligent-recovery. Use for adaptive, theater-free implementation.
skill.summary: Loop 2 of the Three-Loop Integrated Development System. META-SKILL that dynamically compiles Loop 1 ...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation meta-skill. Contains only process documentation and illustrative examples. No executable code, network operations, or file system access beyond standard artifact directories.

content.value_statement: Complex projects require coordinating multiple specialist agents. This meta-skill dynamically assigns tasks to optimal agents based on project requirements, executes work in parallel, and validates that all code is genuine through multi-agent consensus.
actual_capabilities: Dynamically selects optimal agents from 86-agent registry per task
Creates agent+skill assignment matrix with MECE decomposition
Executes 11 parallel agents simultaneously for 8.3x speedup
Detects theater through 6-agent consensus with zero tolerance
Validates code works via sandbox execution and integration tests
Packages delivery for Loop 3 CI/CD quality gates
limitations: Requires Loop 1 planning package as input - cannot start without validated plan
Cannot execute without claude-flow agent ecosystem and memory coordination
Meta-skill requires external Task tool for agent spawning - not self-contained

use_cases.title: Coordinate complex implementations
use_cases.description: Transform validated architecture plans into parallel agent tasks with optimal skill assignments and dependency management

use_cases.title: Scale development throughput
use_cases.description: Deploy multiple specialist agents simultaneously while maintaining quality through theater detection and reality validation

use_cases.title: Build multi-agent pipelines
use_cases.description: Orchestrate 86 specialized agents with adaptive skill-based or custom instruction execution for production systems

prompt_templates.title: Basic implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute parallel-swarm-implementation skill with loop1_planning_package: .claude/.artifacts/loop1-planning-package.json and max_parallel_agents: 11

prompt_templates.title: Custom constraints
prompt_templates.prompt: Run parallel-swarm-implementation with theater_tolerance: 0, integration_threshold: 100, and prefer_skill_based: true

prompt_templates.title: Speed optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute Loop 2 with max_parallel_agents: 20 for maximum throughput. Show agent-skill matrix and parallel group breakdown before execution.

prompt_templates.title: Quality focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Run parallel-swarm-implementation with sandbox_validation: true and detailed theater detection. Show theater consensus report after Step 5.

output_examples.input: Execute parallel-swarm-implementation with Loop 1 planning package
output: ‚úÖ Queen Coordinator created agent+skill matrix: 8 tasks, 4 skill-based, 4 custom
‚úÖ Parallel Group 1 complete: Foundation code implemented
‚úÖ Parallel Group 2 complete: Tests and validation running
‚úÖ Integration Loop: 100% tests passing in 2 iterations

best_practices: Always complete Loop 1 research-driven-planning first - this skill requires validated plans as input
Set theater_tolerance to 0 for production - multi-agent consensus catches incomplete implementations
Use prefer_skill_based: true to leverage existing SOPs when available - more reliable than custom instructions
anti_patterns: Running Loop 2 without Loop 1 plan - leads to suboptimal agent assignments and rework
Skipping theater detection - allows incomplete or mock implementations to ship
Setting integration_threshold below 100 - accepts failing code that will break in production

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Requires claude-flow agent ecosystem for Task tool execution.

faq.question: How many agents can run in parallel?
faq.answer: Default is 11 parallel agents with 8.3x speedup. Configurable from 5 to 20 agents based on project complexity.

faq.question: How does theater detection work?
faq.answer: Six independent agents scan for fake completion - code, tests, docs, sandbox execution, and integration validation with 4/5 consensus.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only accesses .claude/.artifacts/ directories and uses internal memory namespaces. No external network calls.

faq.question: Why is my integration loop not converging?
faq.answer: Fundamental implementation issues may require Loop 3 escalation. Transition to cicd-intelligent-recovery for deep root cause analysis.

faq.question: How is this different from manual agent assignment?
faq.answer: Queen Coordinator dynamically selects optimal agents per task, applies MECE decomposition, and enables 11-way parallel execution versus 1-3 manual agents.
